tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the year in style, collecting a four-stroke victory at the inaugural PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Tour Championship and then finishing T21 at the Web.com Tour Q-School final stage in consecutive weeks at the start of December… Trailed by one entering the final round of the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Tour Championship presented by FirstBank, but carded a 68 in windy conditions for a four-stroke win at the TPC Dorado Beach's East Course. Finished at 273 (-11) for his second career win is as many seasons in Latin America... Had three other top-10s, including a T3 finish at the season opening 68th Avianca Colombia Open in March and a T5 at the Abierto Mexicano de Golf in May… Made the cut in 10 of 13 starts and finished the year ranked 6th on the Order of Merit… Missed the cut at the Albertsons Boise Open in July on his first career start on the Web.com Tour.

2014: Had a strong performance in tough windy conditions to win the Mundo Maya Open, his first PGA TOUR Latinoamérica victory in only four starts. Entered the final day trailing by two strokes and ended up winning by four at the Yucatan Country Club's El Jaguar GC. A best of the final day 4-under 68 secured the win at 10-under 278… Finished T4 at the season opening 67th Arturo Calle Colombian Open in February. Held that event's outright lead after a 7-under 63 on the first round… Had three top-10 finishes and five top-25s while making the cut in 8 of his 16 starts. Finished the Latin American season ranked No. 14 on the Order of Merit… Had joined PGA TOUR Latinoamérica by finishing T16 at the Qualifying Tournament in Lima, Peru in January.

2013: Won an NGA Winter Series event in December at Shingle Creek Resort in Orlando. Shot 65, 67 and 69 to win by one at 201 (-15).

OTHER DETAILS: Has six minitour victories, one on the NGA Tour and five on the West Florida Golf Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A member of the golf team at Florida Gulf Coast University. Won three events in college and was ranked in the top 20 in the "Golfstat " national ranking during his senior year in 2011… Earned All-Area Players of the Year honors in 2006 while at Cypress Lake High School Center of Arts.
tourBios.personal: Has two sisters… His hobbies include outdoors activities and arts… Dr. Jim Suttie, Richard Parange and Richard Abel have been the golf instructors he has worked with… Traveling and visiting new places is what he enjoys the most inside and outside of golf… Never travels without music… The TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra, Beach and Calusa Pines in Naples, Florida are the golf courses he has enjoyed the most… Supports the Florida Gulf Coast University sports teams… The Miami Heat (NBA) is his favorite professional team… Lebron James and Sidney Crosby are his favorite athletes to watch… Favorite food includes ceviche, sushi and seafood… His favorite cities and vacation spots are Seattle, Washington and Portland, Oregon… Game of Thrones is his favorite TV Show… City of God is his favorite movie… Not many people know that he wants to own a vegetable and livestock farm… Wants to learn and become fluent in three or more languages… His favorite quote by Jean Paul Sartre: “Man in nothing else than the ensemble of his acts, nothing else than his life.”… Twitter: @MazziottaDaniel… Instagram: @dmazziotta

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)

tourBios.otherCarHigh: His career scoring average at Florida Gulf Coast University of 73.1 ranks second all-time...Named to the Atlantic Sun All-Conference first team as a senior...Finished with an astonishing 28 top 20s and 20 top 10s over 38 career tournaments.
tourBios.personal: Attended Cypress Lake High School Center for the Arts in Fort Myers, Fla...Would choose Beethoven's 9th symphony as his entrance song on the first tee...Supports the Bryce Burke Foundation named in memory of his cousin...Professional golf buddies call him "Mazz."... Twitter: @MazziottaDaniel… Instagram: @dmazziotta

tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Played in 13 events on Latinoamérica...Finished T3 at the season-opening 68th Avianca Colombia Open in Bogota...A T5 finish at the 57th Abierto Mexicano de Golf in Mexico was followed by a T9 at the 84th Abierto OSDE del Centro in Argentina...Four rounds in the 60s propelled him to his first PGA TOUR Latinoamérica victory at the season finale, the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Championship, which moved him to No. 6 on the Order of Merit...Made his first career start on the Web.com Tour, at the Albertsons Boise Open in July (missed the cut).

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 1st on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri 2 times.
